DataElement.preferredName: Copy Number Analysis Programming Parameter Hidden Markov Model Normal State Minimum Observation java.lang.Integer
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The number of molecules of a particular type on or in a cell or part of a cell. Usually applied to specific genes or to plasmids within a bacterium.:Examination and interpretation; the process of identifying an issue to be understood and addressed, modelling the issue, investigating the model results, interpreting the results, and possibly making a recommendation. The concept also refers to the examination and study of a whole in terms of the parts composing it.:A value that is passed to a routine._A statistical model in which the system being modeled has unknown parameters, but the hidden parameters can be determined from the observable parameters. While the state is not directly visible, the variables influenced by the state are visible. Each state has a probability distribution over the possible output tokens. Therefore the sequence of tokens generated by a Hidden Markov Model (HMM) gives some information about the sequence of states.:Being approximately average or within certain limits; conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm.:The way something is with respect to its main attributes.:The smallest possible quantity.:Watching something and taking note of what happens._Generic value domain for a primitive java dataype that is an Integer (32-bit two's complement).

Concepts.definition: The number of molecules of a particular type on or in a cell or part of a cell. Usually applied to specific genes or to plasmids within a bacterium.

Examination and interpretation; the process of identifying an issue to be understood and addressed, modelling the issue, investigating the model results, interpreting the results, and possibly making a recommendation. The concept also refers to the examination and study of a whole in terms of the parts composing it.
A value that is passed to a routine.

Property.preferredName: Hidden Markov Model Normal State Minimum Observation
Property.preferredDefinition: A statistical model in which the system being modeled has unknown parameters, but the hidden parameters can be determined from the observable parameters. While the state is not directly visible, the variables influenced by the state are visible. Each state has a probability distribution over the possible output tokens. Therefore the sequence of tokens generated by a Hidden Markov Model (HMM) gives some information about the sequence of states.:Being approximately average or within certain limits; conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm.:The way something is with respect to its main attributes.:The smallest possible quantity.:Watching something and taking note of what happens.

Concepts.definition: A statistical model in which the system being modeled has unknown parameters, but the hidden parameters can be determined from the observable parameters. While the state is not directly visible, the variables influenced by the state are visible. Each state has a probability distribution over the possible output tokens. Therefore the sequence of tokens generated by a Hidden Markov Model (HMM) gives some information about the sequence of states.
Being approximately average or within certain limits; conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm.
The way something is with respect to its main attributes.
Watching something and taking note of what happens.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: DEC Released following Silver Compatibility Review and by direction of VCDE workspace.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Generic value domain for a primitive java dataype that is an Integer (32-bit two's complement).

ConceptualDomain.changeDescription: 10.14.20 TL changed WFS from DRAFT NEW to RETIRED ARCHIVED and added an End Date in preparation of OneData.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.

Concepts.definition: A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.
